content.1: Whither is thy beloved gone, O thou fairest among women? whither is thy beloved turned aside? that we may seek him with thee.
content.2: My beloved is gone down into his garden, to the beds of spices, to feed in the gardens, and to gather lilies.
content.5: Turn away thine eyes from me, for they have overcome me: thy hair
content.7: As a piece of a pomegranate
content.8: There are threescore queens, and fourscore concubines, and virgins without number.
content.11: I went down into the garden of nuts to see the fruits of the valley,
content.12: Or ever I was aware, my soul made me
content.13: Return, return, O Shulamite; return, return, that we may look upon thee. What will ye see in the Shulamite? As it were the company of two armies.
